title: WHIRLING F3 / KLAASJE MAIN
description:
Meeting Klaasje again, on the roof
0) Intro
1) Your name and 
2) why u here? (orbs and drugs from room) 
3) Wildflower
5) did you hear me night before / last time we saw
6) Looking for Ruby

dialogueTree.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Look." She greets you, taking a dr..."
dialogueTree.english: "Look." She greets you, taking a drag. "It's dark outside, the dogs are barking and I'm still here, drinking my coffee -- just like I promised." She smiles faintly.
dialogueTree.polish: „Proszę spojrzeć” – wita cię, zaciągając się papierosem. „Na zewnątrz ciemno, psy szczekają, a ja wciąż tu jestem i popijam kawę, tak jak obiecałam” – uśmiecha się słabo.
dialogueTree.belarusian: "Калі ласка, паглядзіце, — яна вітае цябе, зацягваючыся цыгарэтай. — На двары цёмна, сабакі брэшуць, а я ўсё яшчэ тут і п'ю каву, як і абяцала", — яна слаба ўсміхаецца.

links.title: Suggestion: "She did promise she'd be here at ni..."
links.english: She did promise she'd be here at night if you don't arrest her... Good girl.
links.polish: Obiecała, że będzie tutaj nocą, jeśli jej nie aresztujesz... Grzeczna dziewczyna.
links.belarusian: Яна сапраўды абяцала быць тут ноччу, калі ты яе не арыштуеш... Слухмяная дзяўчына.

links.title: Drama: "Pff... It's surely an act. Ask ques..."
links.english: Pff... It's surely an act. Ask questions. Tough ones, preferably.
links.polish: Pff. To z pewnością poza. Zadaj pytania. Najlepiej jakieś trudne.
links.belarusian: Пф. Гэта, безумоўна, паказуха. Задавай пытанні. Пажадана, складаныя.

links.title: You: ""I found your buoy. It was empty. J..."
links.english: "I found your buoy. It was empty. Just seawater."
links.polish: „Znalazłem pani boję. Była pusta. Nie licząc wody morskiej”.
links.belarusian: "Я знайшоў твой буй. Ён быў пусты. Калі не лічыць марской вады".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): "Her eyes widen. "Oh...""
links.english: Her eyes widen. "Oh..."
links.polish: Zdumienie wysoko podnosi jej powieki. „Och...”
links.belarusian: Яе вочы расшыраюцца: "Ох..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Did you take the documents?""
links.english: "Did you take the documents?"
links.polish: „Zabrała pani swoje dokumenty?”
links.belarusian: "Вы забралі дакументы?"

links.title: Reaction Speed: "He's trying to throw her off with t..."
links.english: He's trying to throw her off with the bluntness of the question.
links.polish: Próbuje ją zbić z tropu nagłą bezpośredniością pytania.
links.belarusian: Ён спрабуе збіць яе з панталыку рэзкасцю пытання.

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""No, of course not. As I said, it w..."
links.english: "No, of course not. As I said, it would have been too risky for me to use those documents anyway -- my employer gave them to me. In truth, I should have destroyed them."
links.polish: „Oczywiście, że nie. Mówiłam panu, korzystanie z tych dokumentów byłoby zbyt ryzykowne. Mam je od mojego pracodawcy. Tak naprawdę powinnam była je zniszczyć”.
links.belarusian: "Не, вядома, не. Як я казала, для мяне ў любым выпадку было бы занадта рызыкоўна карыстацца гэтымі дакументамі — я атрымала іх ад майго працадаўцы. Шчыра кажучы, мне варта было іх знішчыць".

links.title: You: ""Did you take the documents?""
links.english: "Did you take the documents?"
links.polish: „Zabrała pani swoje dokumenty?”
links.belarusian: "Ты забрала дакументы?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""No, of course not. As I said, it w..."
links.english: "No, of course not. As I said, it would have been too risky for me to use those documents anyway -- my employer gave them to me. In truth, I should have destroyed them."
links.polish: „Oczywiście, że nie. Mówiłam panu, korzystanie z tych dokumentów byłoby zbyt ryzykowne. Mam je od mojego pracodawcy. Tak naprawdę powinnam była je zniszczyć”.
links.belarusian: "Не, вядома, не. Як я казала, для мяне ў любым выпадку было бы занадта рызыкоўна карыстацца гэтымі дакументамі — я атрымала іх ад майго працадаўцы. Шчыра кажучы, мне варта было іх знішчыць".

links.title: Drama: "She doesn't seem to be lying -- she..."
links.english: She doesn't seem to be lying -- she's genuinely spooked by their disappearance.
links.polish: Nie wydaje się kłamać. Zniknięcie dokumentów naprawdę ją przestraszyło.
links.belarusian: Не падобна, што яна хлусіць — яна непрытворна напалоханая іх знікненнем.

links.title: You: ""My working hypothesis is that ther..."
links.english: "My working hypothesis is that there is a cosmic conspiracy of some kind -- and it's out to get us all."
links.polish: „Moja wstępna hipoteza jest taka, że mamy do czynienia z jakimś kosmicznym spiskiem. Ktoś chce nas wszystkich dopaść”.
links.belarusian: "Мая працоўная гіпотэза палягае на тым, што гэта нейкага кшталту сусветная змова — і яна хоча дабрацца да ўсіх нас".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): "She flashes you a sudden half-smile..."
links.english: She flashes you a sudden half-smile. "Yes, that must be it. Thank you. I feel better already."
links.polish: Posyła ci nagle przelotny półuśmiech. „Tak, to na pewno to. Dziękuję. Od razu mi lżej”.
links.belarusian: Яна кідае табе раптоўную паўусмешку: "Так, мусіць, рэч у гэтым. Дзякуй. Мне ўжо зрабілася лягчэй".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Now that I think about it -- you m..."
links.english: "Now that I think about it -- you mentioned sea water. I was worried I'd been too careless with the latch. The documents were probably," she waves her cigarette, "just washed away..."
links.polish: „Jak tak teraz o tym myślę... wspomniał pan o wodzie morskiej. Bałam się, że nie dość solidnie zabezpieczyłam dokumenty, i pewnie...” – gestykuluje z papierosem w dłoni – „...woda zwyczajnie je zabrała...”
links.belarusian: "Цяпер, калі я пра гэта думаю — вы згадалі марскую ваду. Я хвалявалася, што была неасцярожная з коркам. Дакументы, імаверна, — яна ўзмахвае цыгарэтай, — проста змыла вадой..."

links.title: You: ""I'm afraid you may be in danger.""
links.english: "I'm afraid you may be in danger."
links.polish: „Obawiam się, że może pani grozić niebezpieczeństwo”.
links.belarusian: "Баюся, што табе можа пагражаць небяспека".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): "She thinks for a moment, then shrug..."
links.english: She thinks for a moment, then shrugs. "Yes, I am -- regardless of who took the documents."
links.polish: Zastanawia się przez chwilę, po czym wzrusza ramionami. „Tak, i to niezależnie od tego, kto zabrał te dokumenty”.
links.belarusian: Падумаўшы крыху, яна паціскае плячыма: "Так — і незалежна ад таго, хто забраў дакументы".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""It was probably just an accident...."
links.english: "It was probably just an accident. I was worried I'd been too careless with the latch. The documents were probably just," she waves her cigarette, "washed away..."
links.polish: „To był prawdopodobnie zwykły wypadek. Bałam się, że nie dość solidnie zabezpieczyłam dokumenty, i pewnie” – gestykuluje z papierosem w dłoni – „woda zwyczajnie je zabrała...”
links.belarusian: "Гэта, напэўна, быў няшчасны выпадак. Я хвалявалася, што была неасцярожная з коркам. Дакументы, імаверна, — яна ўзмахвае цыгарэтай, — проста змыла вадой..."

links.title: You: ""Perhaps the people who are after y..."
links.english: "Perhaps the people who are after you took it."
links.polish: „Być może zabrali je ludzie, którzy panią ścigają”.
links.belarusian: "Магчыма, іх забралі людзі, якія цябе пераследуюць".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): "She thinks for a moment, then shrug..."
links.english: She thinks for a moment, then shrugs. "They couldn't know where I put it. I'm absolutely sure I was not followed. And I've told no one but you..."
links.polish: Zastanawia się przez chwilę, po czym wzrusza ramionami. „Nie mogli wiedzieć, gdzie je ukryłam. Jestem całkowicie pewna, że nikt mnie nie śledził. A powiedziałam tylko panu...”
links.belarusian: Падумаўшы крыху, яна паціскае плячыма: "Яны не маглі ведаць, дзе я іх схавала. Я цалкам упэўненая, што ніхто не сачыў за мной. І я нікому не казала, апроч вас..."

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""You mentioned sea water? I was wor..."
links.english: "You mentioned sea water? I was worried I'd been too careless with the latch. The documents were probably," she waves her cigarette, "just washed away..."
links.polish: „Wspomniał pan o wodzie morskiej? Bałam się, że nie dość solidnie zabezpieczyłam dokumenty, i pewnie...” – gestykuluje z papierosem w dłoni – „...woda zwyczajnie je zabrała...”
links.belarusian: "Вы згадалі марскую ваду? Я хвалявалася, што была неасцярожная з коркам. Дакументы, імаверна, — яна ўзмахвае цыгарэтай, — проста змыла вадой..."

links.title: You: ""I have this strange feeling that i..."
links.english: "I have this strange feeling that it was an undiscovered *cryptid* that took your documents."
links.polish: „Mam dziwne przeczucie, że pani dokumenty zabrała nieodkryta *kryptyda*”.
links.belarusian: "У мяне дзіўнае адчуванне, што твае дакументы забраў неадкрыты *крыптыд*".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Cryptid? Of course. That must be i..."
links.english: "Cryptid? Of course. That must be it." She takes a drag of her cigarette, warm amusement in her eyes. "Thank you, I feel better already."
links.polish: „Kryptyda? No jasne. To na pewno ona” – z serdecznym rozbawieniem w oczach wchłania kolejną dawkę dymu. „Dziękuję, od razu mi lepiej”.
links.belarusian: "Крыптыд? Ну вядома. Мусіць, рэч у гэтым, — яна зацягваецца цыгарэтай, у яе вачах цёплая весялосць. — Дзякуй. Мне ўжо зрабілася лягчэй".

links.title: You: ""I'll file this under a *theft* of..."
links.english: "I'll file this under a *theft* of some kind."
links.polish: „Zapiszę to jako jakiegoś rodzaju *kradzież*”.
links.belarusian: "Я аформлю гэта як нейкі *крадзеж*".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Thank you, but actually -- now tha..."
links.english: "Thank you, but actually -- now that I think about it -- you mentioned sea water? I was worried I'd been too careless with the latch mechanism... The documents were probably," she waves her cigarette, "just washed away..."
links.polish: „Dziękuję, ale właściwie... jak tak teraz o tym myślę... wspomniał pan o wodzie morskiej? Bałam się, że nie sprawdziłam dobrze mechanizmu zamknięcia... Pewnie” – gestykuluje z papierosem w dłoni – „woda zwyczajnie zabrała te dokumenty...”
links.belarusian: "Дзякуй, але насамрэч — цяпер, калі я пра гэта думаю — вы згадалі марскую ваду? Я хвалявалася, што была неасцярожная з коркам. Дакументы, імаверна, — яна ўзмахвае цыгарэтай, — проста змыла вадой..."

links.title: Inland Empire: "The words *washed away* sound dista..."
links.english: The words *washed away* sound distant and strange suddenly. Somewhere far away, a dog barks.
links.polish: Słowo „zabrała” nagle wydaje się odległe i dziwne. Gdzieś w oddali szczeka pies.
links.belarusian: Слова *змыла* раптам здаецца далёкім і дзіўным. Недзе ўдалечыні брэша сабака.

links.title: You: ""I can't seem to find Ruby. Do you..."
links.english: "I can't seem to find Ruby. Do you have any idea where she might be?"
links.polish: „Nie mogę nigdzie znaleźć Ruby. Ma pani pomysł, gdzie może być?”
links.belarusian: "Я не магу нідзе знайсці Рубі. Ці ёсць у цябе ідэі, дзе яна можа быць?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I wouldn't know, officer. She had..."
links.english: "I wouldn't know, officer. She had a crash pad somewhere on the coast... but she was very secretive about it, even with me."
links.polish: „Nic mi na ten temat nie wiadomo. Miała jakąś miejscówę gdzieś na wybrzeżu... ale trzymała to w tajemnicy nawet przede mną”.
links.belarusian: "Не маю ўяўлення, інспектару. У яе была схованка недзе на ўзбярэжжы... але яна трымала гэта месца ў сакрэце нават ад мяне".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We found that *crash pad* on the c..."
links.english: "We found that *crash pad* on the coast, miss, and even spoke to the land lady. She seemed... rather devoted to the suspect..."
links.polish: „Znaleźliśmy tę *miejscówkę* na wybrzeżu i rozmawialiśmy nawet z wynajmującą ją kobietą. Sprawiała wrażenie... przywiązanej do podejrzanej...”
links.belarusian: "Мы знайшлі гэтую *схованку* на ўзбярэжжы, пані, і нават размаўлялі з гаспадыняй. Яна падалася... даволі прыхільнай да падазронай..."

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Yes, Ruby has her gruff charm.""
links.english: "Yes, Ruby has her gruff charm."
links.polish: „Tak, Ruby ma ten swój opryskliwy urok”.
links.belarusian: "Так, у Рубі ёсць свой грубаваты шарм".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""...At any rate, the suspect isn't..."
links.english: "...At any rate, the suspect isn't there anymore."
links.polish: „W każdym razie podejrzanej już tam nie ma”.
links.belarusian: "У кожным разе, падазронай там больш няма".

links.title: You: ""Yes, I know about the *crash pad*...."
links.english: "Yes, I know about the *crash pad*. Even spoke to the land lady. But Ruby's not there anymore."
links.polish: „Tak, wiem o *miejscówie*. Rozmawiałem nawet z jej właścicielką. Ale Ruby już tam nie ma”.
links.belarusian: "Так, я ведаю пра *схованку*. Я нават размаўляў з гаспадыняй. Але Рубі там ужо няма".

links.title: You: ""I think I found it, but I couldn't..."
links.english: "I think I found it, but I couldn't get the land lady to talk."
links.polish: „Chyba ją znalazłem, ale nie mogłem nakłonić właścicielki, żeby mi cokolwiek powiedziała”.
links.belarusian: "Мяркую, я яе знайшоў, але не змог прымусіць гаспадыню паразмаўляць".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Ruby has a gruff charm that inspir..."
links.english: "Ruby has a gruff charm that inspires loyalty... I do wish you luck in your search, officer."
links.polish: „Ruby ma taki opryskliwy urok, który zjednuje jej ludzi... Życzę powodzenia w dalszych poszukiwaniach”.
links.belarusian: "У Рубі ёсць грубаваты шарм, які ўзмацняе ў людзях адданасць... Шчыра жадаю поспеху ў пошуках, інспектару".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Thank you, miss." He turns to you...."
links.english: "Thank you, miss." He turns to you. "We should do a thorough search of the fishing village."
links.polish: „Dziękuję za pomoc” – oznajmia kobiecie, po czym zwraca się do ciebie: „Powinniśmy dokładnie przeszukać tę rybacką wieś”.
links.belarusian: "Дзякуй, спадарыня, — ён паварочваецца да цябе: — Мы павінны пільна абшукаць рыбацкую вёску".

Alternate1.english: "Thank you, miss." He turns to you. "We should do a more thorough search of the fishing village."
Alternate1.polish: „Dziękuję za pomoc” – oznajmia kobiecie, po czym zwraca się do ciebie: „Powinniśmy dokładniej przeszukać tę rybacką wieś”.
Alternate1.belarusian: "Дзякуй, спадарыня, — ён паварочваецца да цябе. — Мы павінны больш пільна абшукаць рыбацкую вёску".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Best of luck to you, officers.""
links.english: "Best of luck to you, officers."
links.polish: „Powodzenia, panowie”.
links.belarusian: "Усяго вам найлепшага, афіцэры".

links.title: You: ""I guess I should go ask around the..."
links.english: "I guess I should go ask around the fishing village."
links.polish: „Muszę chyba spytać mieszkańców wioski rybackiej”.
links.belarusian: "Мяркую, мне трэба дапытаць жыхароў рыбацкай вёскі".

Alternate1.english: "I guess I should go ask around more in the fishing village."
Alternate1.polish: „Muszę chyba rozpytać jeszcze wśród mieszkańców wioski rybackiej”.
Alternate1.belarusian: "Мяркую, мне трэба яшчэ раз дапытаць жыхароў рыбацкай вёскі".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Good luck, officer.""
links.english: "Good luck, officer."
links.polish: „Powodzenia, panie mundurowy”.
links.belarusian: "Поспехаў вам, інспектару".

links.title: You: ""Ruby is definitely not at her old..."
links.english: "Ruby is definitely not at her old crash pad anymore."
links.polish: „Ruby ewidentnie nie przebywa już w swojej starej miejscówie”.
links.belarusian: "Рубі відавочна ўжо няма ў старой схованцы".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""That doesn't surprise me... She's..."
links.english: "That doesn't surprise me... She's careful. But -- before you ask -- I really have no clue where she could've gone."
links.polish: „Nie zaskakuje mnie to... Jest ostrożna. Ale zanim pan spyta, naprawdę nie mam pomysłu, dokąd mogła pójść”.
links.belarusian: "Мяне гэта не здзіўляе... Яна асцярожная. Але — перш чым вы спытаеце — у мяне сапраўды няма ўяўлення, куды яна магла пайсці".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""She's in dire straits. Could she h..."
links.english: "She's in dire straits. Could she have hidden in a place to which she has some kind of emotional attachment?"
links.polish: „Ma poważne kłopoty. Czy mogła ukryć się w miejscu, do którego jest przywiązana emocjonalnie?”
links.belarusian: "Яна ў нявыкрутцы. Ці магла яна схавацца ў месцы, да якога ў яе ёсць пэўная эмацыйная прыхільнасць?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Ruby's certainly passionate, but s..."
links.english: "Ruby's certainly passionate, but sentimental -- no, not really... Except maybe about radios -- all kinds of radio technology. So sorry I can't be of any more help to you..."
links.polish: „Ruby jest żywiołowa, ale czy sentymentalna – niekoniecznie... No, może w temacie wszelkiej technologii radiowej. Bardzo mi przykro, że nie jestem zbyt pomocna...”
links.belarusian: "Рубі палкая, але каб сентыментальная — не, не асабліва... Акрамя, хіба, наконт радыё — любых радыётэхналогій. Даруйце, што не магу чымсьці яшчэ дапамагчы..."

links.title: Pain Threshold: "A cornered animal might seek a hidi..."
links.english: A cornered animal might seek a hiding place that has some sentimental value.
links.polish: Osaczone zwierzę może szukać schronienia w miejscu mającym jakieś sentymentalne znaczenie.
links.belarusian: Загнаны ў кут звер можа шукаць прытулак у месцы, якое мае пэўную сентыментальную каштоўнасць.

links.title: You: ""Her situation is pretty bad, where..."
links.english: "Her situation is pretty bad, wherever she is. Maybe she'd hide some place that's meaningful to her?"
links.polish: „Gdziekolwiek przebywa, jej sytuacja nie jest dobra. Może ukrywa się w jakimś istotnym dla niej miejscu?”
links.belarusian: "Дзе бы яна ні знаходзілася, яе сітуацыя даволі дрэнная. Магчыма, яна схавалася бы ў нейкім важным для яе месцы?"

links.title: You: ""Why do I feel like you've *won* he..."
links.english: "Why do I feel like you've *won* here?"
links.polish: „Czemu mam poczucie, że pani tu *wygrała*?”
links.belarusian: "Чаму мне здаецца, што ты тут *перамагла*?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I really don't know, sir." She tak..."
links.english: "I really don't know, sir." She takes a sip of her cold coffee. "I certainly don't *feel* like I've won. I feel like shit, sir. All the time."
links.polish: „Naprawdę nie wiem, panie mundurowy” – upija łyk zimnej kawy. „Bo ja nie mam *poczucia*, że wygrałam. Czuję się parszywie. Nieustannie”.
links.belarusian: "Сапраўды не ведаю, пане, — яна робіць глыток халоднай кавы. — Мне дакладна не *здаецца*, што я парамагла. Я пачуваюся агідна, спадару. Увесь час".

links.title: Empathy: "She smiles. A bitter little smile...."
links.english: She smiles. A bitter little smile. She means it.
links.polish: Uśmiecha się. Lekkim, gorzkim uśmiechem. Mówi poważnie.
links.belarusian: Яна ўсміхаецца. Лёгкай, горкай усмешкай. Яна гэта ўсур'ёз.

links.title: You: ""But this turned out well for you...."
links.english: "But this turned out well for you. You've *slipped* past all suspicions."
links.polish: „Ale skończyło się to dla pani dobrze. *Wymknęła się* pani wszelkim podejrzeniom”.
links.belarusian: "Але для цябе ўсё скончылася добра. Ты *выслізнула* з-пад усіх падазрэнняў".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Clearly, I haven't. We're having t..."
links.english: "Clearly, I haven't. We're having this conversation, aren't we? How *well* could it have gone. I mean... " She looks around.
links.polish: „Najwyraźniej jednak nie. Bo nadal rozmawiamy, prawda? Więc niby w jaki sposób *dobrze* mi poszło? To znaczy...” – rozgląda się.
links.belarusian: "Відавочна, не. Бо мы ўсё яшчэ размаўляем, праўда? Дык як *добра* ўсё можа скончыцца. У сэнсе..." — яна азіраецца.

links.title: Shivers: "The rain falls on her shoulders, ti..."
links.english: The rain falls on her shoulders, tinting her blond hair light brown. It smells of industrial pollution and brine.
links.polish: Deszcz pada na jej ramiona, barwiąc na brązowo jej blond włosy. Czuć go zanieczyszczeniami przemysłowymi i solą.
links.belarusian: Дождж крапае ёй на плечы, фарбуючы яе бялявыя валасы ў светла-брунатны колер. Ён пахне смогам і соллю.

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I'm stuck in Martinaise, just like..."
links.english: "I'm stuck in Martinaise, just like all of us. I've been up here for... I don't know how long now? I like to call this my *rooftop containment facility*."
links.polish: „Utknęłam w Martinaise, tak jak my wszyscy. Jestem tu od... nie wiem już od jak dawna. Nazwałam to sobie na własne potrzeby moim *dachowym zakładem zamkniętym*”.
links.belarusian: "Я захрасла ў Марцінэзе, як і ўсе мы. Я тут ужо... не ведаю, колькі? Я называю гэта маёй *ізаляцыйнай установай на даху*".

links.title: You: ""What are you contained for then?""
links.english: "What are you contained for then?"
links.polish: „I czemu jest pani w zamknięciu?”
links.belarusian: "За што ж ты ізаляваная?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""For my *sins* of course. The long..."
links.english: "For my *sins* of course. The long standing sins of a bad, frivolous person."
links.polish: „Za moje *grzechy*, oczywiście. Nieodpuszczone grzechy złej, frywolnej osoby”.
links.belarusian: "За мае *грахі*, вядома. Даўнія грахі благой, легкадумнай асобы".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""For destroying my first love. For..."
links.english: "For destroying my first love. For working for bad people. The list goes on and on."
links.polish: „Za zniszczenie mojej pierwszej miłości. Za pracę dla złych ludzi. Lista jest długa”.
links.belarusian: "За знішчэнне майго першага кахання. За працу на дрэнных людзей. Спіс можна працягваць бясконца".

links.title: You: ""This all turned out well enough fo..."
links.english: "This all turned out well enough for you -- you somehow managed to not become a *suspect*."
links.polish: „Ułożyło się to dla pani zaskakująco dobrze. Zdołała pani jakoś nie zostać *podejrzaną*”.
links.belarusian: "Для цябе ўсё гэта склалася дастаткова добра — ты неяк здолела не стаць *падазронай*".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Did I?" She arches an eyebrow and..."
links.english: "Did I?" She arches an eyebrow and sighs. "Why do I still feel *suspicion* hanging over me then? What I managed was to get him killed. I understand that."
links.polish: „Naprawdę?” – wygina brew w łuk i wzdycha. „To dlaczego nadal czuję unoszące się nade mną *podejrzenia*? Udało mi się jedno: doprowadzić do jego śmierci. Rozumiem to”.
links.belarusian: "Няўжо? — яна ўздымае брыво і ўздыхае. — Дык чаму ж я ўсё адно адчуваю, што нада мной вісіць *падазрэнне*? Усё, што я здолела — давесці яго да смерці. Я гэта разумею".

Alternate1.english: "Did I?" She arches an eyebrow and sighs. "Why do I still feel *suspicion* hanging over me then? What I managed was to get him killed. I'm the love that does people in, remember?"
Alternate1.polish: „Naprawdę?” – wygina brew w łuk i wzdycha. „To dlaczego nadal czuję unoszące się nade mną *podejrzenia*? Udało mi się jedno: doprowadzić do jego śmierci. Jestem miłością, co prowadzi do zguby, pamięta pan?”
Alternate1.belarusian: "Няўжо? — яна ўздымае брыво і ўздыхае. — Дык чаму ж я ўсё адно адчуваю, што нада мной вісіць *падазрэнне*? Усё, што я здолела — давесці яго да смерці. Я — каханне, якое вядзе да згубы, памятаеце?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant looks away, over the..."
links.english: The lieutenant looks away, over the railing.
links.polish: Porucznik odwraca wzrok i spogląda za balustradę.
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант глядзіць удалечыню, за парэнчы.

links.title: Empathy: "He feels uncomfortable with this co..."
links.english: He feels uncomfortable with this conversation. He doesn't know what to add.
links.polish: Nie czuje się dobrze podczas tej rozmowy. Nie wie, co może dodać.
links.belarusian: Ён пачуваецца няёмка падчас гэтай размовы. Не ведае, што тут дадаць.

links.title: You: ""Something seems... *off* with this..."
links.english: "Something seems... *off* with this theory I've developed. About Ruby."
links.polish: „Coś wydaje się być... *nie tak* z hipotezą, którą opracowałem. Co do Ruby”.
links.belarusian: "Нешта здаецца... *не так* з гіпотэзай, якую я распрацаваў. Наконт Рубі".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I don't know what to say.""
links.english: "I don't know what to say."
links.polish: „Nie wiem, co mogłabym panu powiedzieć”.
links.belarusian: "Я не ведаю, што сказаць".

links.title: You: ""It all seems fortuitous -- for you.""
links.english: "It all seems fortuitous -- for you."
links.polish: „Wszystko to wydaje się niezwykle korzystne. Dla pani”.
links.belarusian: "Усё выглядае вельмі ўдалым — для цябе".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""*None* of this is fortuitous for m..."
links.english: "*None* of this is fortuitous for me."
links.polish: „*Nic* tu nie jest dla mnie korzystne”.
links.belarusian: "*Нічога* тут няма для мяне ўдалага".

links.title: You: ""The dried flowers on the roof -- c..."
links.english: "The dried flowers on the roof -- could Ruby have left them? These don't fit with anything."
links.polish: „Te suszone kwiaty na dachu – czy mogła zostawić je Ruby? Nie pasują do niczego”.
links.belarusian: "Засушаныя кветкі на даху — ці магла Рубі іх пакінуць? Яны ні да чога не пасуюць".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""The what?" She narrows her eyes. "..."
links.english: "The what?" She narrows her eyes. "Oh, those ones! I don't know, sir. I said I have no idea what to make of them. Honestly, I think they're just trash."
links.polish: „Co takiego?” – przestrzeń jej oczu zwęża się. „Ach, te! Nie potrafię panu odpowiedzieć. Mówiłam, że nic mi nie przychodzi do głowy. Szczerze mówiąc, myślę, że to zwykłe śmieci”.
links.belarusian: "Што? — яна прымружвае вочы. — Ах, тыя! Не ведаю, спадару. Як я казала, не маю ўяўлення, што з імі рабіць. Шчыра кажучы, я думаю, што гэта проста смецце".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I mean, there's no reason for me t..."
links.english: "I mean, there's no reason for me to think they're somehow connected to her."
links.polish: „Nie wiem, jakiego ich związku z nią miałabym się dopatrywać”.
links.belarusian: "Я маю на ўвазе, што ў мяне няма прычын думаць, што яны неяк з ёй звязаныя".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): "She narrows her eyes. "You mean tha..."
links.english: She narrows her eyes. "You mean that little thing you caught -- when you first came here? On the roof there?"
links.polish: Mruży oczy. „Ma pan na myśli te maleństwa, które złapał pan tu za pierwszym razem? Tam, na dachu?”
links.belarusian: Яна прымружвае вочы: "Вы пра тую кветачку, якую вы злавілі — калі прыйшлі сюды ўпершыню? На дах?"

links.title: You: ""Yes.""
links.english: "Yes."
links.polish: „Tak”.
links.belarusian: "Так".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I don't know, sir. I said I have n..."
links.english: "I don't know, sir. I said I have no idea what to make of them. Honestly, I think they're just trash"
links.polish: „Nie potrafię panu odpowiedzieć. Mówiłam, że nic mi nie przychodzi do głowy. Szczerze mówiąc, myślę, że to zwykłe śmieci”.
links.belarusian: "Не ведаю, спадару. Як я казала, не маю ўяўлення, што з імі рабіць. Шчыра кажучы, я думаю, што гэта проста смецце".

links.title: You: ""That's it then, I guess." (Conclud..."
links.english: "That's it then, I guess." (Conclude.)
links.polish: „To chyba na tyle”. (Zakończ).
links.belarusian: "На гэтым, напэўна, усё". (Скончыць.)

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): "She nods, slowly -- carefully, even..."
links.english: She nods, slowly -- carefully, even.
links.polish: Kiwa głową powoli, ostrożnie wręcz.
links.belarusian: Яна ківае, павольна — нават асцярожна.

links.title: Volition: "There is suddenly a strange glint i..."
links.english: There is suddenly a strange glint in her eyes. Not malicious... but dangerous.
links.polish: Nagle w jej oczach pojawia się dziwny blask. Nie zdradza złych zamiarów... lecz i tak jest niebezpieczny.
links.belarusian: Раптам у яе вачах з'яўляецца дзіўны бляск. Не зламысны... але небяспечны.

links.title: Shivers: "The snow falls on her shoulders, th..."
links.english: The snow falls on her shoulders, then melts in her light blond hair... Cold and soft.
links.polish: Śnieg pada jej na ramiona, po czym topnieje wśród jej jasnoblond włosów... Zimny i miękki.
links.belarusian: Снег падае ёй на плечы, а потым растае на яе бялявых валасах... Халодны і мяккі.

links.title: Shivers: "The wet wind, heavy with brine and..."
links.english: The wet wind, heavy with brine and industrial pollution from the stacks nearby, ruffles her hair.
links.polish: Mokry wiatr, ciężki od soli i zanieczyszczeń z pobliskich kominów, targa jej włosy.
links.belarusian: Вільготны вецер, цяжкі ад солі і смогу з навакольных комінаў, калмаціць яе валасы.

links.title: You: ""You're right.""
links.english: "You're right."
links.polish: „Ma pani rację”.
links.belarusian: "Ты маеш рацыю".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""How *well* could it have turned ou..."
links.english: "How *well* could it have turned out for me. I mean... " She looks around.
links.polish: „Niby jak *dobrze* mogłam na tym wyjść? To znaczy...” – rozgląda się.
links.belarusian: "Дык як *добра* усё можа для мяне скончыцца. У сэнсе..." — яна азіраецца.

links.title: You: "In god's name, *wake up*!"
links.english: In god's name, *wake up*!
links.polish: Na boga, *obudź się*!
links.belarusian: Дзеля Бога, *прачніся*!

links.title: You: ""Let's get back to those lies you t..."
links.english: "Let's get back to those lies you told."
links.polish: „Wróćmy do tych kłamstw, które pani wygłosiła”.
links.belarusian: "Вернемся да той хлусні, што ты расказала".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Lies, I..." She repeats -- then tr..."
links.english: "Lies, I..." She repeats -- then trails off. It's unclear what she intended to say.
links.polish: „Kłamstw, które...” – powtarza, ale urywa. Nie wiadomo, co zamierzała powiedzieć.
links.belarusian: "Хлусні, што..." — яна паўтарае, а потым змаўкае. Незразумела, што яна збіралася сказаць.

links.title: Drama: "Yes! We demand she be punished for..."
links.english: Yes! We demand she be punished for deceiving us. We demand her anxiety. We demand her fear.
links.polish: Tak! Żądamy, by została ukarana za to, że nas zwiodła. Oczekujemy jej niepokoju. Oczekujemy jej strachu.
links.belarusian: Так! Мы патрабуем яе пакарання за тое, што яна ўвяла нас у зман. Мы патрабуем яе трывогі. Мы патрабуем яе страху.

links.title: You: ""It has.""
links.english: "It has."
links.polish: „Tak właśnie było”.
links.belarusian: "Так і было".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""They *also* say it's why the clean..."
links.english: "They *also* say it's why the cleaning lady quit."
links.polish: „Mówią *też*, że to dlatego pani sprzątająca zrezygnowała”.
links.belarusian: "*Яшчэ* кажуць, што праз гэта пайшла прыбірачка".

links.title: You: "Look up to the grey sky."
links.english: Look up to the grey sky.
links.polish: Spójrz w górę, na szare niebo.
links.belarusian: Зірнуць наверх, на шэрае неба.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "No need to dilly-dally. She's tough..."
links.english: No need to dilly-dally. She's tough.
links.polish: Nie ma co owijać w bawełnę. To twarda kobieta.
links.belarusian: Няма чаго валаводзіць. Яна трывалая.

links.title: You: "I'll go straight to it. I don't wan..."
links.english: I'll go straight to it. I don't wanna sound like a namby-pamby.
links.polish: Przejdę od razu do rzeczy. Nie chcę brzmieć jak jakiś ciamajda.
links.belarusian: Адразу перайду да справы. Не хачу гучаць як недалуга.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "Good on you, boy. She can take it."
links.english: Good on you, boy. She can take it.
links.polish: Bardzo dobrze, chłopie. Da dziewczyna radę.
links.belarusian: Малайчына, хлопча. Яна дасць рады.

links.title: You: "Thanks Coach, but I think I'll *dil..."
links.english: Thanks Coach, but I think I'll *dilly dally* this time.
links.polish: Dzięki, trenerze, ale tym razem chyba *owinę w bawełnę*.
links.belarusian: Дзякуй, трэнер, але гэтым разам я, напэўна, *павалаводжу*.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "YOU'LL SOUND LIKE A NAMBY-PAMBY!"
links.english: YOU'LL SOUND LIKE A NAMBY-PAMBY!
links.polish: BĘDZIESZ BRZMIAŁ JAK CIAMAJDA!
links.belarusian: ТЫ БУДЗЕШ ГУЧАЦЬ ЯК НЕДАЛУГА!

links.title: Authority: "Coach Physical Instrument is overdo..."
links.english: Coach Physical Instrument is overdoing it -- even by my standards. Say something else first.
links.polish: Trener ciało jako narzędzie trochę przesadza, nawet jak na moje standardy. Powiedz najpierw coś innego.
links.belarusian: Трэнер Фізічны Інструмент перабольшвае — нават па маіх стандартах. Скажы спачатку нешта іншае.

links.title: You: ""What is your name, miss? For the r..."
links.english: "What is your name, miss? For the record."
links.polish: „Jak ma pani na imię? To do akt”.
links.belarusian: "Як тваё імя? Гэта для пратакола".

Alternate1.english: "Can I ask more about you? For the record."
Alternate1.polish: „Mogę dowiedzieć się więcej o pani? To do akt”.
Alternate1.belarusian: "Ці магу я даведацца больш пра цябе? Гэта для пратакола".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Sure." She takes a drag."
links.english: "Sure." She takes a drag.
links.polish: „Ma się rozumieć” – napełnia płuca dymem z papierosa.
links.belarusian: "Вядома", — яна робіць зацяжку.

links.title: You: ""And where are you from?""
links.english: "And where are you from?"
links.polish: „Skąd pani jest?”
links.belarusian: "Адкуль ты?"

Alternate1.english: "Are you from Oranje?"
Alternate1.polish: „Jest pani z Oranje?”
Alternate1.belarusian: "Ці ты з Аранье?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Vredefort, Republic of Oranje.""
links.english: "Vredefort, Republic of Oranje."
links.polish: „Z Vredefortu w Republice Oranje”.
links.belarusian: "З Врэдэфорта, Рэспубліка Аранье".

Alternate1.english: "Right sir. Vredefort, Republic of Oranje. I guess you could say I am an Oranjese *expatriate*."
Alternate1.polish: „Zgadza się. Z Vredefortu w Republice Oranje. Można chyba powiedzieć, że jestem oranjeską *ekspatriantką*”.
Alternate1.belarusian: "Так, спадару. З Врэдэфорта, Рэспубліка Аранье. Мяркую, можна сказаць, што я араньезская *эмігрантка*".

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Wasn't the tattoo on the hanged man..."
links.english: Wasn't the tattoo on the hanged man an *Oranjese* Map of the Waterways? The thought begins to form in your head, then dissipates -- something for later.
links.polish: Czy tatuaż wisielca nie przedstawiał *oranjeskiej* mapy szlaków wodnych? W twojej głowie pojawia się myśl, po czym ucieka. To sprawa na później.
links.belarusian: Ці не была татуіроўка павешанага *Араньезскай* Мапай Водных Шляхоў? Думка пачынае фармавацца ў тваёй галаве, але потым рассейваецца — гэта пытанне на потым.

links.title: Reaction Speed: "The victim's ethnicity *could* have..."
links.english: The victim's ethnicity *could* have been Oranjese... -- something for later?
links.polish: Możliwe, że ofiara *też* pochodziła z Oranje – może warto się nad tym później pochylić?
links.belarusian: Ахвяра *магла* паходзіць з Аранье... — пытанне на потым?

links.title: You: ""What is Oranje?""
links.english: "What is Oranje?"
links.polish: „Co to jest Oranje?”
links.belarusian: "Што такое Аранье?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""A bad memory, officer.""
links.english: "A bad memory, officer."
links.polish: „Przykre wspomnienie”.
links.belarusian: "Прыкры ўспамін, інспектару".

links.title: Encyclopedia: "The Republic of Oranje is a democra..."
links.english: The Republic of Oranje is a democratic nation on the Mundi isola, north of here, over the sea and across the pale. It is one of the six major Occidental nations to hold stake in the continued occupation of Revachol (the Coalition). People consider it a *reasonable* superpower.
links.polish: Republika Oranje to demokratyczny kraj na isoli Mundi, na północ stąd, za morzem i po drugiej stronie szaroty. To jeden z sześciu dużych krajów Okcydentu biorących udział w trwającej okupacji Revacholu (czyli tzw. Koalicji). Ludzie uważają ją za *rozsądną* superpotęgę.
links.belarusian: Рэспубліка Аранье — дэмакратычная краіна на ісоле Мундзі, на поўнач адсюль, за морам і на другім баку цьмянасці. Гэта адна з шасці асноўных Акцыдэнтальных краін, якія ўдзельнічаюць у працяглай акупацыі Рэвашоля (г. зв. Кааліцыя). Людзі лічаць яе *разважлівай* звышдзяржавай.

links.title: You: "Reasonable?"
links.english: Reasonable?
links.polish: Rozsądną?
links.belarusian: Разважлівай?

links.title: Encyclopedia: "They will make you into a fiscal co..."
links.english: They will make you into a fiscal colony, divert your natural resources, hold patents and shares, but they won't threaten to *wipe you out any time* like Revachol did in its prime.
links.polish: Uczynią z ciebie kolonię fiskalną, pozbawią cię zasobów naturalnych, przejmą patenty i udziały, lecz nie będą grozić, że *w każdej chwili mogą cię zmiażdżyć*, jak to w czasach swojej świetności robił Revachol.
links.belarusian: Яны ператвораць цябе ў падатковую калонію, адбяруць твае прыродныя рэсурсы, завалодаюць патэнтамі і акцыямі, але не будуць пагражаць *знішчыць цябе ў любы момант*, як гэта ў часы свайго росквіту рабіў Рэвашоль.

links.title: You: ""A bad memory of what?""
links.english: "A bad memory of what?"
links.polish: „Przykre wspomnienie czego?”
links.belarusian: "Прыкры ўспамін пра што?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Of lilacs and lightning." She squi..."
links.english: "Of lilacs and lightning." She squints her eyes as if to see them in the distance. "Parks, glass, duraluminium -- Vredefort is a conference city. It's always autumn there. And night. At least it was for me."
links.polish: „Bzu i błyskawicy” – mruży oczy, jak gdyby chciała dostrzec w oddali to, o czym mówi. „Parki, szkło, duraluminium – Vredefort to miasto konferencyjne. Tam zawsze jest jesień. I noc. W każdym razie dla mnie”.
links.belarusian: "Пра бэз і маланкі, — яна прымружвае вочы, быццам спрабуе ўбачыць іх удалечыні. — Паркі, шкло, дзюралюмін — Врэдэфорт — гэта горад канферэнцый. Там заўсёды восень. І ноч. Прынамсі, так было для мяне".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What's so bad about that?""
links.english: "What's so bad about that?"
links.polish: „Co jest w tym takiego złego?”
links.belarusian: "Што ў гэтым такога прыкрага?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Nothing -- if you're no longer the..."
links.english: "Nothing -- if you're no longer there."
links.polish: „Zupełnie nic, kiedy już tam nie mieszkasz”.
links.belarusian: "Нічога — калі ты там ужо не жывеш".

links.title: Empathy: "The conference centres are filled w..."
links.english: The conference centres are filled with people who get angry at you if you do something *wrong*.
links.polish: Centra konferencyjne pełne są ludzi, którzy się na ciebie złoszczą, kiedy zrobisz coś *źle*.
links.belarusian: Канферэнц-цэнтры поўныя людзей, якія злуюцца на цябе, калі ты робіш нешта *дрэннае*.

links.title: You: ""Did you do something wrong?""
links.english: "Did you do something wrong?"
links.polish: „Zrobiła pani coś złego?”
links.belarusian: "Ці зрабіла ты нешта дрэннае?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Sooner or later, everyone does.""
links.english: "Sooner or later, everyone does."
links.polish: „Tak jak każdy wcześniej czy później”.
links.belarusian: "Раней ці пазней кожны робіць".

links.title: You: "Let it be."
links.english: Let it be.
links.polish: Odpuść.
links.belarusian: Пакінуць усё як ёсць.

links.title: You: ""And what's so bad about that?""
links.english: "And what's so bad about that?"
links.polish: „I co w tym wszystkim takiego złego?”
links.belarusian: "І што ў гэтым такога прыкрага?"

links.title: You: ""Understood, miss.""
links.english: "Understood, miss."
links.polish: „Rozumiem, proszę pani”.
links.belarusian: "Зразумеў, спадарыня".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""It's the past." She takes a sip of..."
links.english: "It's the past." She takes a sip of her coffee. "People can't go back to the past."
links.polish: „To przeszłość” – upija łyk kawy. „Nie da się wrócić do przeszłości”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта мінулае, — яна робіць глыток кавы. — Немагчыма вярнуцца ў мінулае".

links.title: Rhetoric: "Thankfully -- it's implied."
links.english: Thankfully -- it's implied.
links.polish: „Na szczęście” – zdaje się mówić jej ton.
links.belarusian: На шчасце — маецца на ўвазе.

links.title: You: ""What do you do, miss? What is your..."
links.english: "What do you do, miss? What is your *specialization*?"
links.polish: „Czym się pani zajmuje? Jaka jest pani *specjalizacja*?”
links.belarusian: "Чым ты займаешся? Якая твая *спецыялізацыя*?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Something stupid.""
links.english: "Something stupid."
links.polish: „To coś bardzo głupiego”.
links.belarusian: "Нешта дурное".

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Wanna hear what's stupid? Somewhere..."
links.english: Wanna hear what's stupid? Somewhere in a one room apartment on Boogie Street a young man shows Patrol Officer Tillbrook his genital warts, asking if they're *cancer*.
links.polish: Chcesz usłyszeć coś naprawdę głupiego? Gdzieś w jednopokojowym mieszkaniu na Boogie Street młody mężczyzna pokazuje funkcjonariuszowi patrolowemu Tillbrookowi swoją opryszczkę genitalną, pytając, czy to *rak*.
links.belarusian: Хочаш пачуць штосьці сапраўды дурное? Недзе ў аднапакаёвай кватэры на Бугі-стрыт малады чалавек паказвае патрульнаму афіцэру Цілбруку свае генітальныя бародаўкі, запытваючы, ці гэта *рак*.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "His partner Émile Mollins can't be..."
links.english: His partner Émile Mollins can't be there -- he's in another apartment with another man who's showing him a dead dog under the radiator. 'It's dead,' Mollins says. "No," the man replies. "I touched him. He's warm."
links.polish: Jego partner, Émile Mollins, nie może tam być. Jest w innym mieszkaniu, z innym mężczyzną, który pokazuje mu martwego psa pod kaloryferem. „On nie żyje” – mówi Mollins. „Nie” – odpowiada mężczyzna. „Dotknąłem go. Jest ciepły”.
links.belarusian: Яго партнёр, Эміль Молінс, не можа быць там — ён у іншай кватэры, з іншым мужчынам, які паказвае яму мёртвага сабаку пад батарэяй. "Ён памёр", — кажа Молінс. "Не, — адказвае мужчына. — Я дакрануўся да яго. Ён цёплы".

links.title: Esprit de Corps: ""He's warm," Mollins replies, "beca..."
links.english: "He's warm," Mollins replies, "because he's under the radiator."
links.polish: „Tak, jest ciepły” – odpowiada Mollins. „Bo leży pod kaloryferem”.
links.belarusian: "Ён цёплы, — адказвае Молінс, — бо ляжыць пад батарэяй".

links.title: You: ""You're a cop?""
links.english: "You're a cop?"
links.polish: „Jest pani policjantką?”
links.belarusian: "Ты паліцыянтка?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""No-no. *More* stupid -- Oranjese l..."
links.english: "No-no. *More* stupid -- Oranjese lit."
links.polish: „Nie, nie. Coś *jeszcze* głupszego. Litka oranjeska”.
links.belarusian: "Не-не. Нешта *яшчэ* дурнейшае — араньезліт".

links.title: You: ""What's that?""
links.english: "What's that?"
links.polish: „Co takiego?”
links.belarusian: "Чым гэта?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Oranjese lit.""
links.english: "Oranjese lit."
links.polish: „Litka oranjeska”.
links.belarusian: "Араньезлітам".

links.title: You: ""Oranjese lit?""
links.english: "Oranjese lit?"
links.polish: „Litka oranjeska?”
links.belarusian: "Араньезлітам?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Oranjese literature. It's what I s..."
links.english: "Oranjese literature. It's what I studied *at the university*." She raises both eyebrows.
links.polish: „Literatura oranjeska. Zgłębiałam ją *na uniwersytecie*” – unosi obie brwi.
links.belarusian: "Араньезская літаратура. Я вывучала яе *ва ўніверсітэце*", — яна ўздымае бровы.

links.title: You: ""What is Oranjese literature about?""
links.english: "What is Oranjese literature about?"
links.polish: „O czym traktuje literatura oranjeska?”
links.belarusian: "Пра што араньезская літаратура?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Fear of failure, fear of death. Ho..."
links.english: "Fear of failure, fear of death. How it *sucks* to be Oranjese. All national literatures are -- only the name of the nation changes."
links.polish: „O lęku przed porażką, przed śmiercią. O tym, że bycie Oranjejczykiem jest *do kitu*. Tak samo jak każda literatura narodowa. Zmienia się tylko nazwa państwa”.
links.belarusian: "Пра страх паразы, страх смерці. Пра тое, як *пагана* быць араньезцам. Як і любая нацыянальная літаратура — змяняецца толькі назва нацыі".

links.title: Conceptualization: "What about Revacholian literature?..."
links.english: What about Revacholian literature? People sometimes reveal things about themselves when they discuss such matters...
links.polish: A revacholska literatura? Ludzie czasem zdradzają wiele o sobie, dyskutując na takie tematy.
links.belarusian: Што наконт рэвашольскай літаратуры? Людзі часам выдаюць шмат пра сябе, абмяркоўваючы такія тэмы...

links.title: You: ""Revacholian literature too?""
links.english: "Revacholian literature too?"
links.polish: „Literatura revacholska też?”
links.belarusian: "Рэвашольская літаратура таксама?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""No!" She seems glad that you asked..."
links.english: "No!" She seems glad that you asked. "Revacholian lit is about how *magnificent and serious* Revachol is. It's about how you have to save the world."
links.polish: „Nie!” – jest wyraźnie zadowolona, że o to pytasz. „Revacholska jest o tym, jak *wspaniały i poważny* jest Revachol. I że musisz walczyć o ocalenie świata”.
links.belarusian: "Не! — яна выглядае задаволенай, што ты спытаў. — Рэвашольліт пра тое, які *надзвычайны і сур'ёзны* Рэвашоль. Пра тое, як ты мусіш выратаваць свет".

links.title: You: ""I have no intention of doing that.""
links.english: "I have no intention of doing that."
links.polish: „Nie mam zamiaru tego robić”.
links.belarusian: "Я не маю намеру гэтага рабіць".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""That's just a phase the Revacholia..."
links.english: "That's just a phase the Revacholian hero goes through..." She breathes in the menthol-flavoured fumes, savouring it...
links.polish: „To faza, przez którą musi przejść revacholski bohater...” – wdycha mentolowe opary, delektując się nimi...
links.belarusian: "Гэта ўсяго толькі фаза, праз якую праходзіць Рэвашольскі герой... — яна ўдыхае ментолавы дым, смакуючы яго...

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): "...then breathes out. "Before they..."
links.english: ...then breathes out. "Before they plunge into full-core humanity- and world-saving."
links.polish: ...po czym uwalnia dym do atmosfery. „Nim zaakceptuje w pełni swoją misję na rzecz ludzkości i ocalenia świata”.
links.belarusian: ...і потым выдыхае. — Перш чым занурыцца з галавой у ратаванне чалавецтва і свету".

links.title: You: ""I do feel the urge to save the wor..."
links.english: "I do feel the urge to save the world, yes. I guess that's why I'm on this case."
links.polish: „Tak, rzeczywiście czuję potrzebę ocalenia świata. Chyba dlatego właśnie pracuję nad tą sprawą”.
links.belarusian: "Я сапраўды адчуваю патрэбу выратаваць свет. Мабыць, таму я і працую над гэтай справай".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""That's the natural state of the Re..."
links.english: "That's the natural state of the Revacholian hero..." She breathes in the menthol flavoured fumes, savouring it -- then breathes out.
links.polish: „To naturalne odczucia revacholskiego bohatera...” – wdycha mentolowe opary, delektując się nimi, po czym uwalnia je do atmosfery.
links.belarusian: "Гэта натуральны стан Рэвашольскага героя..."— яна ўдыхае ментолавы дым, смакуючы яго, і потым выдыхае.

links.title: Empathy: "She seems quite relaxed for a victi..."
links.english: She seems quite relaxed for a victim of assault. But, of course, what *seems* should not be your priority.
links.polish: Wydaje się bardzo rozluźniona jak na ofiarę napaści. Ale to, co się *wydaje*, nie powinno być dla ciebie, rzecz jasna, kluczowe.
links.belarusian: Яна здаецца надта разняволенай для ахвяры нападу. Але вядома, тое, што *здаецца*, не павінна быць тваім прыярытэтам.

links.title: You: ""The world is unimportant -- I want..."
links.english: "The world is unimportant -- I want to hear about you."
links.polish: „Świat jest nieistotny. Chciałbym się dowiedzieć więcej o pani”.
links.belarusian: "Свет неістотны — я хацеў бы пачуць пра цябе".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Strange, usually the Revacholian h..."
links.english: "Strange, usually the Revacholian hero does not save women..." She breathes in the menthol flavoured fumes, savouring it...
links.polish: „Dziwne, zwykle revacholski bohater nie dba o ocalenie kobiet...” – wdycha mentolowe opary, delektując się nimi....
links.belarusian: "Дзіўна, звычайна Рэвашольскі герой не ратуе жанчын... — яна ўдыхае ментолавы дым, смакуючы яго...

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): "...then breathes out: "It's a frivo..."
links.english: ...then breathes out: "It's a frivolous pursuit. He saves all of mankind instead."
links.polish: ...po czym uwalnia dym do atmosfery. „Bo to są błahe cele, gdy na szali jest los ludzkości”.
links.belarusian: ...і потым выдыхае. — Гэта легкадумнае памкненне. Замест гэтага ён ратуе ўсё чалавецтва".

links.title: Inland Empire: "If that's true then *Revacholian li..."
links.english: If that's true then *Revacholian lit* would fit you like a glove.
links.polish: Jeśli to prawda, to *revacholska litka* pasowałaby ci jak rękawiczka.
links.belarusian: Калі гэта праўда, то *рэвашольліт* ідэальна бы табе пасавала.

links.title: You: ""Back to you.""
links.english: "Back to you."
links.polish: „Wracając do pani”.
links.belarusian: "Вернемся да цябе".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Back to me." She breathes in the m..."
links.english: "Back to me." She breathes in the menthol-flavoured fumes, savouring it in her lungs.
links.polish: „Wracając do mnie” – wdycha mentolowe opary, delektując się nimi, gdy trafiają do jej płuc.
links.belarusian: "Вернемся да мяне", — яна ўдыхае ментолавы дым, смакуючы, утрымлівае яго ў лёгкіх.

links.title: You: ""Could I see your passport, please?""
links.english: "Could I see your passport, please?"
links.polish: „Mogę zobaczyć pani paszport?”
links.belarusian: "Ці магу я, калі ласка, убачыць твой пашпарт?"

Alternate1.english: "Could we take a look at your passport, please?"
Alternate1.polish: „Moglibyśmy zobaczyć pani paszport?”
Alternate1.belarusian: "Ці можам мы, калі ласка, зірнуць на твой пашпарт?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I'm afraid you can't, officer.""
links.english: "I'm afraid you can't, officer."
links.polish: „Przykro mi, ale nie”.
links.belarusian: "Баюся, што не можаце, інспектар".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Why is that?""
links.english: "Why is that?"
links.polish: „Dlaczego?”
links.belarusian: "Чаму гэта?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Because it's buried in a sealed pl..."
links.english: "Because it's buried in a sealed plastic bag at an undisclosed location on the coast. Along with cash and airline tickets."
links.polish: „Ponieważ jest zakopany w zapieczętowanej torebce gdzieś na wybrzeżu. A razem z nim gotówka i bilety lotnicze”.
links.belarusian: "Таму што ён пахаваны ў запячатаным пакеце ў невядомым месцы на ўзбярэжжы. Разам з гатоўкай і авіябілетамі".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Thank you for your candour -- why?""
links.english: "Thank you for your candour -- why?"
links.polish: „Dziękuję za szczerość. Dlaczego?”
links.belarusian: "Дзякуй вам за шчырасць — чаму?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""They say so in your tourist brochu..."
links.english: "They say so in your tourist brochure -- keep travel documents away from your person when west of the river."
links.polish: „Tak radzą w waszej broszurce dla turystów – wybierając się na zachód od rzeki, nie bierz ze sobą dokumentów podróżnych”.
links.belarusian: "У вашай брашуры для турыстаў напісана: не трымайце пры сабе падарожных дакументаў, калі знаходзіцеся на захадзе ад ракі".

links.title: You: ""I'm pretty sure I have the legal r..."
links.english: "I'm pretty sure I have the legal right to demand your passport, miss."
links.polish: „Jestem niemal pewien, że mam prawo żądać, aby okazała pani paszport”.
links.belarusian: "Я амаль упэўнены, што маю законнае права патрабаваць, каб ты прад'явіла пашпарт, пані".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Officer, I like this place, but I..."
links.english: "Officer, I like this place, but I don't want to be stuck *wandering* the city like a ghost after being robbed of my travel documents."
links.polish: „Proszę pana, podoba mi się tutaj, ale nie chcę skończyć jako *snująca się* po mieście zjawa, której ktoś ukradł dokumenty”.
links.belarusian: "Інспектару, мне тут падабаецца, але я не хачу захраснуць, *блукаючы* па горадзе, як здань, калі ў мяне скрадуць дакументы".

Alternate1.english: "Look officers," she turns to face you both, "I like this place, but I don't want to be stuck *wandering* the city like a ghost after being robbed of my travel documents."
Alternate1.polish: „Panowie” – patrzy teraz na was obydwu. „Podoba mi się tutaj, ale nie chcę skończyć jako *snująca się* po mieście zjawa, której ktoś ukradł dokumenty”.
Alternate1.belarusian: "Слухайце, афіцэры, — яна паварочваецца, каб бачыць вас абодвух. — Мне тут падабаецца, але я не хачу захраснуць, *блукаючы* па горадзе, як здань, калі ў мяне скрадуць дакументы".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I don't want to become an indentur..."
links.english: "I don't want to become an indentured servant in a brothel on Boogie Street -- and I don't want my relatives to pay the ransom."
links.polish: „Nie chcę pracować niedobrowolnie w burdelu na Boogie Street i nie chcę, żeby moi krewni musieli płacić okup”.
links.belarusian: "Я не хачу прыслугоўваць пад прымусам у бардэлі на Бугі-стрыт — і не хачу, каб мае сваякі павінны былі плаціць выкуп".

links.title: Logic: "There are plenty of other reasons f..."
links.english: There are plenty of other reasons for hiding your documents from the law.
links.polish: Jest mnóstwo innych powodów, dla których można ukrywać dokumenty przed stróżami prawa.
links.belarusian: Ёсць процьма іншых прычын, каб утойваць дакументы ад праваахоўных органаў.

links.title: You: ""That's not why you hid it, though.""
links.english: "That's not why you hid it, though."
links.polish: „Ale nie dlatego go pani ukryła”.
links.belarusian: "Аднак ты не таму яго схавала".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""It's *also* why I hid it.""
links.english: "It's *also* why I hid it."
links.polish: „*Między innymi* dlatego”.
links.belarusian: "*У тым ліку* таму".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Why else?" He's suddenly very atte..."
links.english: "Why else?" He's suddenly very attentive.
links.polish: „Co jest dodatkowym powodem?” Nagle porucznik stał się bardzo uważny.
links.belarusian: "Чаму яшчэ?" — раптам ён робіцца вельмі ўважлівым.

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I'm an unpopular girl." She takes..."
links.english: "I'm an unpopular girl." She takes a drag. "There are people back home who don't like me -- if they show up, I'm in a *hurry*."
links.polish: „Nie cieszę się powszechną sympatią” – zaciąga się. „W mojej ojczyźnie nie wszyscy za mną przepadają i, jeśli nagle się zjawią, będę się bardzo *spieszyć*”.
links.belarusian: "Я не папулярная дзяўчына, — яна зацягваецца. — Дома ёсць людзі, якія мяне не любяць — калі яны раптам з'явяцца, я буду вельмі *спяшацца*".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""The kind of hurry where you can't..."
links.english: "The kind of hurry where you can't afford to *not* find your documents -- but don't worry. This has *nothing* to do with your investigation."
links.polish: „Tak bardzo, że nie będę sobie mogła pozwolić na *nie*znalezienie dokumentów, ale bez obaw – to nie ma *nic* wspólnego z tym śledztwem”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта такая спешка, калі не можаш дазволіць сабе *не* знайсці дакументаў — але не турбуйцеся. Гэта не мае *ніякага* дачынення да вашага расследавання".

links.title: You: ""Why else?""
links.english: "Why else?"
links.polish: „A dlaczego jeszcze?”
links.belarusian: "Чаму яшчэ?"

links.title: You: ""What kind of *people* are these --..."
links.english: "What kind of *people* are these -- the ones that don't like you?"
links.polish: „Co to za *ludzie*? Ci, co za panią nie przepadają?”
links.belarusian: "Што гэта за *людзі* — тыя, якія не любяць цябе?"

Alternate1.english: "The people who don't like you -- you mean the ones you're running from, right?"
Alternate1.polish: „Ci, co za panią nie przepadają, to ci, przed którymi pani ucieka, zgadza się?”
Alternate1.belarusian: "Людзі, якія цябе не любяць, — ты маеш на ўвазе тых, ад каго ты ўцякаеш, так?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I would *love* to change the subje..."
links.english: "I would *love* to change the subject. It's not important. Unless I'm some kind of... suspect?" She arches an eyebrow.
links.polish: „*Chętnie* zmieniłabym już temat. To nie jest ważne. Chyba że jestem o coś... podejrzana?” – unosi pytająco brew.
links.belarusian: "Я бы *вельмі хацела* змяніць тэму. Гэта не важна. Хіба што я нейкім чынам... падазроная?" — яна ўздымае брыво.

links.title: Logic: "Didn't she say you would have to *i..."
links.english: Didn't she say you would have to *interrogate* her? Before? And that she *didn't do it*? What was up with that?
links.polish: Czy ona nie mówiła, że będziesz musiał ją *przesłuchać*? Wtedy, wcześniej? I że tego *nie zrobiła*? O co wtedy chodziło?
links.belarusian: Ці не казала яна, што ты павінен будзеш яе *дапытаць*? Тады, раней? І што яна гэтага *не рабіла*? Пра што ішла гаворка?

links.title: You: ""Earlier you said I would have to *..."
links.english: "Earlier you said I would have to *interrogate* you. Suspects are interrogated."
links.polish: „Mówiła pani wcześniej, że będę musiał panią *przesłuchać*. Przesłuchuje się podejrzanych”.
links.belarusian: "Раней ты казала, што мне прыйдзецца цябе *дапытаць*. Дапытваюць падазроных".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Well-well." She leans back. "It se..."
links.english: "Well-well." She leans back. "It seems I either underestimated you -- or overestimated your hangover, officer."
links.polish: „No, no” – odchyla się. „Zdaje się, że albo pana nie doceniłam, albo przeceniłam pańskiego kaca”.
links.belarusian: "Так-так, — яна адхіляецца назад. — Здаецца, я або недаацаніла вас — або пераацаніла вашае пахмелле, інспектару".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""If I didn't know better, I'd say y..."
links.english: "If I didn't know better, I'd say you feigned that 'fuck-having' line to get me to say something stupid. Was that so?"
links.polish: „Jeszcze gotowa bym była pomyśleć, że ten tekst o »robieniu jebania« to taki wybieg, który miał mnie sprowokować do powiedzenia czegoś głupiego. Czy tak?”
links.belarusian: "Не ведай я лепей, то падумала б, што вы наўмысна ляпнулі гэтую фразу пра 'шлыханне', каб справакаваць мяне сказаць нешта дурное. Ці так гэта?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant gives you a little l..."
links.english: The lieutenant gives you a little look.
links.polish: Porucznik rzuca na ciebie okiem.
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант зіркае на цябе.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "It's good we discussed your history..."
links.english: It's good we discussed your history with her, he thinks. I can play along.
links.polish: Dobrze, że przedyskutowaliśmy wasze wcześniejsze spotkanie. Mogę zagrać w tę grę.
links.belarusian: Добра, што мы абмеркавалі вашу з ёй гісторыю, думае ён. Я магу падыграць.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "We should have discussed your histo..."
links.english: We should have discussed your history before we came here, he thinks. So many unpleasant surprises with this guy...
links.polish: Powinniśmy byli porozmawiać o waszym wcześniejszym spotkaniu, zanim tu przyszliśmy – myśli. Tyle skrywasz niemiłych niespodzianek...
links.belarusian: Мы павінны былі абмеркаваць вашу гісторыю, перш чым прыйсці сюды, думае ён. Столькі непрыемных сюрпрызаў у гэтага хлопца...

links.title: You: ""Totally.""
links.english: "Totally."
links.polish: „Absolutnie”.
links.belarusian: "Дакладна".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Cool. You told us about the invest..."
links.english: "Cool. You told us about the investigation Friday night. Downstairs. At a table full of local kids and dockworkers. You told pretty much everyone. After you showed them your gun, that is..."
links.polish: „Super. Powiedział nam pan o śledztwie w piątek wieczorem. Na parterze. Przy stole, w towarzystwie lokalnych dzieciaków i pracowników portowych. Słyszeli to praktycznie wszyscy. To znaczy, zaraz po tym, jak pokazał im pan swoją broń...”
links.belarusian: "Файна. Вы расказалі нам пра расследаванне ў пятніцу ўвечары. Унізе. За сталом, поўным мясцовых дзяцей і партовых рабочых. Вы расказалі літаральна ўсім. Пасля таго, як паказалі ім свой пісталет, вось так..."

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Anyway -- I thought it would be *f..."
links.english: "Anyway -- I thought it would be *funny* to say I didn't do it. Because I knew about your investigation..." She cringes. "Does that make me a suspect? I really must stop saying stupid things..."
links.polish: „W każdym razie pomyślałam sobie, że *zabawnie* będzie, jak powiem, że tego nie zrobiłam. Bo wiedziałam o śledztwie...” – wzdryga się. „Teraz jestem podejrzaną? Muszę przestać gadać, co mi ślina na język przyniesie...”
links.belarusian: "У кожным разе — я падумала, што будзе *смешна*, калі я скажу, што я гэтага не рабіла. Бо я ведала пра расследаванне... — яна ніякавее. — Гэта робіць мяне падазронай? Мне варта перастаць казаць лухту..."

links.title: You: ""Turns out it did suck -- for *you*.""
links.english: "Turns out it did suck -- for *you*."
links.polish: „Okazuje się, że faktycznie było przypałowo. Dla *pani*”.
links.belarusian: "Выходзіць, што гэта насамрэч было пагана. Для *цябе*".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Not too hard. You told us about th..."
links.english: "Not too hard. You told us about the investigation Friday night. Downstairs. At a table full of local kids and dockworkers. You told pretty much everyone. After you showed them your gun..."
links.polish: „Niespecjalnie. Powiedział nam pan o śledztwie w piątek wieczorem. Na parterze. Przy stole, w towarzystwie lokalnych dzieciaków i pracowników portowych. Słyszeli to praktycznie wszyscy. Zaraz po tym, jak pokazał im pan swoją broń...”
links.belarusian: "Не асабліва. Вы расказалі нам пра расследаванне ў пятніцу ўвечары. Унізе. За сталом, поўным мясцовых дзяцей і партовых рабочых. Вы расказалі літаральна ўсім. Пасля таго, як паказалі ім свой пісталет..."

links.title: You: ""No, that was *sincere*.""
links.english: "No, that was *sincere*."
links.polish: „Nie, to było *szczere*”.
links.belarusian: "Не, гэта было *шчыра*".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I'm flattered. You told us about t..."
links.english: "I'm flattered. You told us about the investigation Friday night. Downstairs. At a table full of local kids and dockworkers. You told pretty much everyone. After you showed them your gun..."
links.polish: „Uznam to za komplement. Powiedział nam pan o śledztwie w piątek wieczorem. Na parterze. Przy stole, w towarzystwie lokalnych dzieciaków i pracowników portowych. Słyszeli to praktycznie wszyscy. Zaraz po tym, jak pokazał im pan swoją broń...”
links.belarusian: "Я ўсцешана. Вы расказалі нам пра расследаванне ў пятніцу ўвечары. Унізе. За сталом, поўным мясцовых дзяцей і партовых рабочых. Вы расказалі літаральна ўсім. Пасля таго, як паказалі ім свой пісталет..."

links.title: You: ""Not yet.""
links.english: "Not yet."
links.polish: „Jeszcze nie”.
links.belarusian: "Пакуль не".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Whooh..." She wipes her brow."
links.english: "Whooh..." She wipes her brow.
links.polish: „Ufff...” – ociera pot z czoła.
links.belarusian: "Фух..." — яна выцірае пот з ілба.

links.title: Empathy: "Playfully. She doesn't seem to be o..."
links.english: Playfully. She doesn't seem to be overly distressed. Or distressed at all, really.
links.polish: Figlarnie. Nie wydaje się szczególnie przejęta. Ani w ogóle jakkolwiek przejęta.
links.belarusian: Жартаўліва. Яна не здаецца надта ўстурбаванай. Ці ўвогуле ўстурбаванай, насамрэч.

links.title: You: ""No. I've just come to talk.""
links.english: "No. I've just come to talk."
links.polish: „Nie. Przychodzę tylko porozmawiać”.
links.belarusian: "Не. Я проста прыйшоў пагаварыць".

Alternate1.english: "No. We've just come to talk."
Alternate1.polish: „Nie. Przyszliśmy tylko porozmawiać”.
Alternate1.belarusian: "Не. Мы проста прыйшлі пагаварыць".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Whooh..." She wipes her brow."
links.english: "Whooh..." She wipes her brow.
links.polish: „Ufff...” – ociera pot z czoła.
links.belarusian: "Фух..." — яна выцірае пот з ілба.

links.title: You: ""You might be.""
links.english: "You might be."
links.polish: „Może i tak”.
links.belarusian: "Можа і так".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""No, I'm not." She waves you off."
links.english: "No, I'm not." She waves you off.
links.polish: „Wcale nie” – odpędza tę ewentualność gestem dłoni.
links.belarusian: "Зусім не", — яна адмахваецца.

links.title: Empathy: "She doesn't seem to be overly distr..."
links.english: She doesn't seem to be overly distressed. Or distressed at all, really.
links.polish: Nie wydaje się szczególnie przejęta. Ani w ogóle jakkolwiek przejęta.
links.belarusian: Яна не здаецца надта ўстурбаванай. Ці ўвогуле ўстурбаванай, насамрэч.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""My colleague has an *exploratory*..."
links.english: "My colleague has an *exploratory* sense of humour. Don't hold it against him."
links.polish: „Mój kolega ma bardzo *eksploracyjne* poczucie humoru. Proszę nie mieć mu tego za złe”.
links.belarusian: "Мой калега мае *нестандартнае* пачуццё гумару. Калі ласка, не крыўдуйце на яго".

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "He's thinking: "I like this kind of..."
links.english: He's thinking: "I like this kind of prodding, whatever the situation. It may lead somewhere yet..."
links.polish: „Podoba mi się takie sondowanie, niezależnie od sytuacji” – myśli. „Może nas do czegoś doprowadzi...”
links.belarusian: Ён думае: "Мне падабаецца такое падштурхоўванне, незалежна ад сітуацыі. Гэта можа да нечага прывесці..."

links.title: You: ""How do I know you've told us your..."
links.english: "How do I know you've told us your real name?"
links.polish: „Skąd mam wiedzieć, że podała nam pani prawdziwe nazwisko?”
links.belarusian: "Адкуль мне ведаць, што ты сказала нам сапраўднае імя?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""If I were to lie to you, I would c..."
links.english: "If I were to lie to you, I would come up with a more *mainstream* name than *Klaasje Amandou*. It's... a weird name."
links.polish: „Gdybym miała pana okłamać, wymyśliłabym jakieś *popularniejsze* imię, a nie *Klaasje Amandou*. Bo to... jest dziwne”.
links.belarusian: "Калі б я хацела вас падмануць, то прыдумала б больш *тыповае* імя, чым *Клаас'е Аманду*. Гэта... дзіўнае імя".

links.title: Drama: "She seems to be telling the truth,..."
links.english: She seems to be telling the truth, sire.
links.polish: Wydaje się mówić prawdę, szanowny panie.
links.belarusian: Здаецца, яна кажа праўду, васпане.

links.title: You: ""Okay then." (Conclude.)"
links.english: "Okay then." (Conclude.)
links.polish: „Rozumiem”. (Zakończ).
links.belarusian: "Добра тады". (Скончыць.)

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Okie-dokie." She pours herself mor..."
links.english: "Okie-dokie." She pours herself more coffee.
links.polish: „No spoko” – dolewa sobie kawy.
links.belarusian: "Добранька", — яна налівае сабе яшчэ кавы.

links.title: Composure: "If any of this made her nervous, it..."
links.english: If any of this made her nervous, it certainly doesn't show in her expression or her movements.
links.polish: Jeśli cokolwiek z tej rozmowy ją zdenerwowało, to ani trochę nie okazuje tego swoim wyrazem twarzy ani ruchami.
links.belarusian: Калі штосьці з размовы яе ўстурбавала, то гэтага дакладна не бачна ў яе выразе твару або рухах.

links.title: You: ""Why?""
links.english: "Why?"
links.polish: „Dlaczego?”
links.belarusian: "Чаму?"

links.title: You: ""Why?""
links.english: "Why?"
links.polish: „Dlaczego?”
links.belarusian: "Чаму?"

links.title: You: ""Okay.""
links.english: "Okay."
links.polish: „Dobrze”.
links.belarusian: "Добра".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Thank you for your understanding."..."
links.english: "Thank you for your understanding." She looks a little surprised.
links.polish: „Dziękuję za zrozumienie” – wygląda na nieco zaskoczoną.
links.belarusian: "Дзякуй за разуменне", — яна выглядае крыху здзіўленай.

links.title: You: ""Thank you. That's it -- for the re..."
links.english: "Thank you. That's it -- for the record."
links.polish: „Dziękuję. To już wszystko. Do akt”.
links.belarusian: "Дзякуй. Мы скончылі — для пратакола".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""'The record' -- so official!""
links.english: "'The record' -- so official!"
links.polish: „*Do akt*, jak oficjalnie!”
links.belarusian: "'Для пратакола' — як афіцыйна!"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Klaasje Amandou.""
links.english: "Klaasje Amandou."
links.polish: „Klaasje Amandou”.
links.belarusian: "Клаас'е Аманду".

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Same name that Titus gave you. Like..."
links.english: Same name that Titus gave you. Like her accent, it sounds Oranjese.
links.polish: To samo imię podał ci Titus. Brzmi oranjesko, tak samo jak jej akcent.
links.belarusian: Гэтае ж імя назваў табе Цітус. Гучыць па-араньезску, як і яе акцэнт.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "Her birthmarks also signal Oranje...."
links.english: Her birthmarks also signal Oranje. You don't know why, but Oranjese girls tend to come speckled with them.
links.polish: Pieprzyki też sugerowałyby oranjeskie pochodzenie. Nie wiesz czemu, ale dziewczyny stamtąd zawsze mają ich mnóstwo.
links.belarusian: Яе радзімкі таксама кажуць пра Аранье. Ты не ведаеш чаму, але араньезскія дзяўчыны звычайна імі ўсыпаныя.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Same name that Titus gave you. It s..."
links.english: Same name that Titus gave you. It sounds Oranjese -- as does her accent.
links.polish: To samo imię podał ci Titus. Brzmi oranjesko. Jej akcent podobnie.
links.belarusian: Гэтае ж імя назваў табе Цітус. Гучыць па-араньезску — як і яе акцэнт.

links.title: You: ""I need to talk to you about your r..."
links.english: "I need to talk to you about your room again."
links.polish: „Muszę porozmawiać z panią znowu o pani pokoju”.
links.belarusian: "Мне трэба зноў пагаварыць з табой пра твой пакой".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Yeah?""
links.english: "Yeah?"
links.polish: „Tak?”
links.belarusian: "Так?"

links.title: You: ""What are you doing here -- in the..."
links.english: "What are you doing here -- in the Whirling-in-Rags?"
links.polish: „Co pani robi tutaj, w Whirling-in-Rags?”
links.belarusian: "Што ты тут робіш — у Whirling-in-Rags?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I'm wintering.""
links.english: "I'm wintering."
links.polish: „Zimuję”.
links.belarusian: "Зімую".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""How long have you been staying her..."
links.english: "How long have you been staying here?"
links.polish: „Od jak dawna pani tu przebywa?”
links.belarusian: "Як даўно вы тут знаходзіцеся?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): "She calculates. "About four months...."
links.english: She calculates. "About four months. I came in November."
links.polish: Oblicza. „Jestem tu jakieś cztery miesiące. Od listopada”.
links.belarusian: Яна падлічвае: "Нешта каля чатырох месяцаў. Я прыехала ў лістападзе".

links.title: Logic: "The bills downstairs concur."
links.english: The bills downstairs concur.
links.polish: Rachunki na dole to potwierdzają.
links.belarusian: Рахункі ўнізе гэта пацвярджаюць.

links.title: You: ""Why here?""
links.english: "Why here?"
links.polish: „Dlaczego tutaj?”
links.belarusian: "Чаму тут?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Here in the Whirling, here in Mart..."
links.english: "Here in the Whirling, here in Martinaise, or here in Revachol?"
links.polish: „Tutaj w Whirling, tutaj w Martinaise czy tutaj w Revacholu?”
links.belarusian: "Тут у Whirling, тут у Марцінэзе ці тут у Рэвашолю?"

links.title: You: ""Here in the Whirling.""
links.english: "Here in the Whirling."
links.polish: „Tutaj w Whirling”.
links.belarusian: "Тут у Whirling".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Because it's the funkiest building..."
links.english: "Because it's the funkiest building in Martinaise. And because all the other buildings are bombed to hell."
links.polish: „Bo to najbardziej funkowy budynek w Martinaise. I przy okazji jeden z niewielu, których bomby nie przerobiły na gruzy”.
links.belarusian: "Таму што гэта самы фанкавы будынак у Марцінэзе. І таму што ўсе астатнія будынкі разбомбленыя дашчэнту".

links.title: You: ""Here in Martinaise.""
links.english: "Here in Martinaise."
links.polish: „Tutaj w Martinaise”.
links.belarusian: "Тут у Марцінэзе".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I heard this is where the washed u..."
links.english: "I heard this is where the washed up disco has-beens go."
links.polish: „Słyszałam, że tutaj trafiają dawni discowcy, czy może to, co z nich zostało”.
links.belarusian: "Чула, што сюды кіруюцца аджылыя аматары дыска".

links.title: You: ""You came to the right place.""
links.english: "You came to the right place."
links.polish: „Przybyła pani we właściwe miejsce”.
links.belarusian: "Ты прыбыла ў правільнае месца".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): "She looks at you and nods."
links.english: She looks at you and nods.
links.polish: Potakuje z utkwionym w tobie wzrokiem.
links.belarusian: Яна глядзіць на цябе і ківае.

links.title: You: ""You're too young to call yourself..."
links.english: "You're too young to call yourself a disco has-been."
links.polish: „Jest pani za młoda, żeby nazywać się dawnym discowcem”.
links.belarusian: "Ты занадта маладая, каб называць сябе аджылай аматаркай дыска".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): "She smirks. "I'm really not.""
links.english: She smirks. "I'm really not."
links.polish: Uśmiecha się bez wesołości. „Wcale nie”.
links.belarusian: Яна ўсміхаецца: "Зусім не".

links.title: You: ""No. This is Sassytown. It's where..."
links.english: "No. This is Sassytown. It's where the future of dance lies."
links.polish: „Nie. To Miasto Cwaniaków. Tu narodzi się przyszłość dance'u”.
links.belarusian: "Не. Гэта Зухавінск. Тут палягае будучыня танцаў".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""If you say so, officer -- if you s..."
links.english: "If you say so, officer -- if you say so."
links.polish: „Skoro pan tak twierdzi, to niech i tak będzie”.
links.belarusian: "Як скажаце, інспектару, як скажаце".

links.title: You: ""Here in Revachol.""
links.english: "Here in Revachol."
links.polish: „Tutaj w Revacholu”.
links.belarusian: "Тут у Рэвашолю".

links.title: You: ""Here on the Insulindian isola.""
links.english: "Here on the Insulindian isola."
links.polish: „Tutaj na Isoli Insulindiańskiej”.
links.belarusian: "Тут на Інсуліндыйскай ісоле".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Came to see the New New World," sh..."
links.english: "Came to see the New New World," she shrugs. "It's a tourist thing."
links.polish: „Byłam ciekawa Nowego Nowego Świata” – wzrusza ramionami. „To taki turystyczny fetysz”.
links.belarusian: "Прыехала пабачыць Новы Новы Свет, — яна паціскае плячыма. — Гэта пра турызм".

links.title: Rhetoric: "This is by far not the only reason..."
links.english: This is by far not the only reason she's here -- she isn't overtly hiding it, either.
links.polish: To nie jest w żadnym razie jedyny powód, dla którego tu jest. Nieszczególnie to nawet ukrywa.
links.belarusian: Гэта ні ў якім разе не адзіная прычына, па якой яна тут — ды яна гэтага асабліва і не хавае.

links.title: You: ""What happened to the old New World?""
links.english: "What happened to the old New World?"
links.polish: „Co się stało ze starym Nowym Światem?”
links.belarusian: "Што здарылася са старым Новым Светам?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""It turned out to be a tzaraath-inf..."
links.english: "It turned out to be a tzaraath-infested third-world slum."
links.polish: „Okazał się zżeranymi przez tzaraath slumsami Trzeciego Świata”.
links.belarusian: "Ён аказаўся ахопленымі цараатам трушчобамі трэцяга свету".

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Called Iilmaraa. And it didn't. Eve..."
links.english: Called Iilmaraa. And it didn't. Even after the Mesque colonized it seven ways from Sunday it's an industrial power house.
links.polish: Zwanymi Iilmarą. I to nieprawda. Nawet po tym, jak Meskowie skolonizowali ją na wszelkie możliwe sposoby, pozostała przemysłową potęgą.
links.belarusian: Называецца Іільмара. І гэта няпраўда. Нават пасля таго, як Меск каланізаваў яе з галавы да ног, яна засталася прамысловым гігантам.

links.title: You: ""What happened to the Old World?""
links.english: "What happened to the Old World?"
links.polish: „Co się stało ze Starym Światem?”
links.belarusian: "Што здарылася са Старым Светам?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Conference centres. A lot of them.""
links.english: "Conference centres. A lot of them."
links.polish: „Centra konferencyjne. Cała masa takich centrów”.
links.belarusian: "Канферэнц-цэнтры. Процьма іх.".

links.title: You: ""Understood.""
links.english: "Understood."
links.polish: „Rozumiem”.
links.belarusian: "Зразумеў".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Funkytown," she says and takes a s..."
links.english: "Funkytown," she says and takes a sip of her coffee.
links.polish: „Funkowo” – odpowiada i podnosi kubek do ust.
links.belarusian: "Фанкапаль", — кажа яна і робіць глыток кавы.

links.title: Conceptualization: "What was that? Funkytown?"
links.english: What was that? Funkytown?
links.polish: Że co? Funkowo?
links.belarusian: Гэта што было? Фанкапаль?

links.title: You: ""How long have you been wintering?""
links.english: "How long have you been wintering?"
links.polish: „Od jak dawna tu pani zimuje?”
links.belarusian: "Як даўно ты тут зімуеш?"

links.title: You: ""What's funky?""
